meanings.definition: An offer made in response to a previous bid in a negotiation or auction.
meanings.sent1: During the auction, the highest bidder made a counterbid to compete with the previous offer.
meanings.sent2: The seller considered the counterbid before deciding on the final price.
meanings.sent3: The counterbid from the new buyer sparked a bidding war among the participants.
meanings.sent4: Her counterbid was like a strategic move in a game of chess, trying to outmaneuver the opponent.
meanings.sent5: The counterbid stood out as a bold move, changing the course of the negotiation.

meanings.definition: To make a bid in response to a previous bid.
meanings.sent1: He decided to counterbid after carefully evaluating the initial offer.
meanings.sent2: Players often counterbid to stay competitive in the auction.
meanings.sent3: She playfully counterbid, pretending to be a tough negotiator.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, companies counterbid to secure lucrative contracts.
meanings.sent5: The decision to counterbid can sometimes lead to better deals in negotiations.
